intro: Elaeagnus caspica, commonly known as the Caspian silverberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, edible berries that ripen in the fall. The plant has a rapid growth rate and is often used for erosion control due to its extensive root system. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Elaeagnus caspica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to fix nitrogen, enriching the soil.
